episode_title: 408 - The One With Chandler in a Box

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is sitting at the counter reading a magazine as the phone rings.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, it’s me. I know you can’t stand to be in the same room as me, so I just thought I’d try and apologize over the phone. All I… (Joey hangs up the phone in disgust.)
(Pause)
(The phone rings again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look I never should have kissed your girlfriend, but I’m… (Joey hangs up the phone again.)
(Pause)
(The phone rings yet again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Stop callin’!!

content.speaker: Voice
content.text: Hey! Hey! Hey! This is 92.3, WXRK, K-Rock for our $1,000 daily challenge.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Voice
content.text: What is the name of your roommate who is very, very sorry and would do anything… (Joey realizes it’s Chandler and hangs up the phone in anger.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone but Joey and Chandler are there getting ready for Thanksgiving.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aww, turkey! Aww, giving thanks! Aww!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look everyone, it’s the spirit of Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So are things with you and Joey any better?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They couldn’t be worse. I spent eight hours calling him last night, just trying to get him to talk to me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow, eight hours? So you could probably really use one of those plug-in telephone headsets huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Should we all expect Christmas gifts that can be stolen from your office?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You shouldn’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Speaking of Christmas, umm since Monica and I are starting a new business and have like no money, umm, this year maybe we could do secret Santa, and then we each only buy one gift. And-and there’s the added mystery of who gets who.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who gets whom. (They all look at him.) I don’t know why I do that.
[Cut to later, the gang, minus Joey, is watching the Thanksgiving Day parade.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’m gonna take a nap, turkey makes me sleepy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We haven’t eaten yet!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, but all that work you’re doing to get it ready, I just… (goes into her bedroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, by any chance did either of pick uh Rachel for your secret Santa, ‘cause I wanna trade for her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I picked her! Oh thank God you want her! Ooh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! Why do you want to get rid of her so badly?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because she exchanges every gift she ever gets, it’s like impossible to get her something she likes. Come on, let’s trade!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s not true! That’s not true! I got her that backpack and she loved it! I remember how much she was crying the day when that big dog ran off with it… (notices the look on Monica and Phoebe’s faces.) Oh, there was no big dog. All right this sucks! I already got her this briefcase, and I had R.G. put on it… (Phoebe looks confused.) Her initials…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, maybe you could give to somebody else. Ooh, like Ross Geller.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Op, y’know what though, it’s kind’ve a girlie briefcase.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who cares? He works in a museum!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, what time is it? The big game is about to start!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You don’t have to do that, Ross and Joey aren’t here, you can watch the parade if you want.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is wrong with this freezer?! (She jabs her arm into the freezer and a piece of ice flies into her eye.) Ow! Ow!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God, what happened?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, ice just got in my eye!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: People are trying to sleep in here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica got ice in her eye, and it hurts.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Open it up, let me see.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, y’know what, I can’t, it really kills.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well maybe you should put some ice on it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, God it looks bad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, maybe we should take you to a doctor.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, my eye doctor is Richard! I can’t go to him when I don’t have a boyfriend!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s really picky about his patients.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Honey, you’ve got to go. What’s his office number?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Like I remember his office number! (Pause) Speed dial 7.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! Yeah, I’m calling on behalf of Monica Geller’s eye, and is um, is Richard Burke in today. (Listens) (to Monica) He’s out of town, but does she want to see the on-call doctor?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! She’s very excited about that.
[Cut to later, Phoebe is adding butter to something and Ross is watching.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is so cool, ‘til Monica gets back, it’s like I’m head chef and I get to make all the decisions. (She looks at the remaining butter, and then decides to add it to the dish.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey, I thought she told you to follow the recipe exactly!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, get out of my kitchen!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! Okay! I think I am making some progress with Joey, when I went into the apartment he went straight into his bedroom but he only slammed the door once! (Ross is pleased.) I mean yeah, he gave me the finger while doing it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right I… I gotta call my mom and ask her a left handed cooking question.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So listen ah, I picked Monica for secret Santa, but I’m already getting her something for Chanukah, I was wondering if you wanna switch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh y’know what, I was already trying to trade for ah, well, you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?! Wow! That’s-that’s so nice, what are you gonna get me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know R.G., I was thinking something girlie for your office.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well maybe Phoebe will switch with me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no, you don’t want to do that, then you’re gonna get stuck with Rachel and she exchanges every gift she ever gets.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, that’s not true! I’ve got her lots of stuff she never took back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Like?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Like uh, that gold necklace I got her last year.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When was the last time you saw her wear it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, she wore it all Christmas day, and then uh…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Big dog?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is repacking the furniture into boxes to return it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sending back all this stuff that Chandler bought out of guilt.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Everything? Even the TV?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! I’m putting that in my room.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, Joey, I know what he did was wrong but don’t you think you could at least hear the guy out?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Back when you and Rachel were together, if Chandler had kissed her, would you hear him out?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s a good point. So uh, how long are you gonna punish him?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Five years.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’ve sentenced him?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Don’t do the crime if you can’t do the time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, the guy’s your best friend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, was my best friend. Anyway, I don’t know why you’re pushing for him so hard. With him out of the way as my best friend, there’s a spot open.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, who? Me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! I’m honored! And y’know what I’m gonna do as my first act as your best friend?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna get you to talk to Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. But if you weren’t my best friend.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Kathy are sitting at a table and talking about Joey.

content.text: KATHY: Oh my God, is it really that bad?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I walk into a room and he won’t even talk to me, he just mumbles something in Italian. And I know he only knows the bad words.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Gunther, have you uh, have you seen Chandler?
GUNTHER: I thought you were Chandler. But umm, one of who is over there.
(Joey turns around and sees them kissing.)
KATHY: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: (Storms out.)

content.description: Dr. Burke’s office, Rachel and Monica are waiting as the doctor arrives.

content.speaker: Doctor
content.text: I’ll be right with you. Okay? (to the nurse) Thanks, Wendy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! How cute is the on-call doctor?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, so cute, that I’m thinking about jamming this pen in my eye.
(The intercom buzzes.)

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Dr. Burke will see you know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no-no-no, not Dr. Burke. Dr. Burke is out of town. The-the on-call doctor will see me now.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Dr. Richard Burke is out of town. Dr. Timothy Burke, his son, will see you now.

content.speaker: Dr. Timothy Burke
content.text: Ready?
(Monica looks at Rachel, who gives her the thumbs up.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is packing as Chandler rushes in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! I’m sorry! That—(sees that Joey is about to leave) where are you going?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My folks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, uh, when-when are you coming back?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. I might stay there for a few days while I look for an apartment.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, y’know at first I thought we could talk about this y’know, work it out, but uh, seeing you two together I don’t think I…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look, what do you want me to say? Do you want me to say that I’ll stop seeing her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, it’s not about her. Okay? But seeing you two together just reminds me of what you did. And I don’t want to live with some one who doesn’t know what it is to be a friend. So, I’ll see ya. (He starts to leave, but Chandler grabs his bag and stops him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look, I know what it is to be a friend, I just-I just screwed up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! You did! And that’s why I’m leaving.
(The chick and the duck walk into the living room.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right look, if you’re not gonna stay for me, then at least stay for them! Okay, they have had a very difficult year! What with the robbery and all!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When that guy was robbing us, and I was locked in the entertainment unit for like six hours, you know what I was doing in there all that time? I was thinking about how I let you down!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! But if would’ve know what kind of friend you were gonna turn out to be, I wouldn’t have worried about it so much! See you around!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, wait! Come on! Just wait one second! There has to be something that I can do! Something! If we still had that entertainment unit I would get in it for six hours and think about how I let you down. (Joey looks intrigued) What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’ve got a box. (Motions to a large wooden box next to him.)

content.description: Dr. Burke’s office, Tim is examining Monica.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Last time I saw you, it was the morning I left for college. And you were just standing outside The Dairy Queen .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was probably waiting for it to open.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: I gotta tell you, you look great now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You look great too.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: You’re an excellent patient!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So how does it look?

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Well, you’ve got a little scratch on your cornea, your gonna have to wear a patch for a couple of days.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Like a pirate?!

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: If that helps you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, so how long have you been working with your dad? (He looks at her) Come on, one of us had to mention him.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: I moved back here a couple of months ago.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Big family dinner tonight?

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Uh. (He holds up a brown lunch bag.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No way!

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: I was gonna have Thanksgiving at my girlfriend’s.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: But we broke up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: She-she wasn’t ready for a serious commitment.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. (in a pirate’s voice) So you made her walk the plank? Aye, matie?

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: You’re not wearing the patch yet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, It’s closer to dinner. Monica has just told everyone that Tim is coming to dinner.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He’s coming here for Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, it’s sick.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why is it sick?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because it’s Richard’s son! It’s like inviting Greek tragedy over for dinner!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, come on, Phoebe, you understand don’t you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I can see where I’d be your best shot but, no. I’m sorry, but I think it’s twisted.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s twisted?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me going out with Richard’s son.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ewwwww!! Ew! Ew! Ew!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sounds like a really bad idea to me.
content.parenthetical: He is now in the box, in their living room.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is he okay in there?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s fine!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know, Mon, if things wrong out between you and Richard’s son, you’d be able to tell your kids, that you slept with their grandfather.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine! Judge all you want to but, (points to Ross) married a lesbian, (points to Rachel) left a man at the altar, (points to Phoebe) fell in love with a gay ice dancer, (points to Joey) threw a girl’s wooden leg in a fire, (points to Chandler) livin’ in a box!! (goes to her room)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So now, what exactly is the point of the box?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The meaning of the box is three fold. One (holds a finger up through the air hole), it gives me the time to think about what I did. Two (holds up another finger), it proves how much I care about my friendship with Joey. And three (holds up a third finger), it hurts!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hey! Hey uh, you remember the necklace I gave you last year? Can I see it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just wanna check something.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (She goes into her bedroom)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: (to Chandler) Now, we’ll see.
content.parenthetical: He puts his hand over the hole on the box.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Air hole! Air hole!! (Ross retracts his hand quickly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here it is! I love it. I wear it all the time.
content.parenthetical: coming out of her bedroom with a necklace

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The necklace I got you was gold, this one is silver.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh, well maybe it uh, it changed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! You actually exchanged it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well isn’t it better that I exchanged it for something that I enjoy and that I can get a lot of use out of?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What did you get?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Credit.
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! (opens the door) Hi, Tim.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Hi. (gives her a bottle of wine)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. Come meet my friends. This is uh, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Hi, nice to meet you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Hi, Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My brother, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And Rachel. (Chandler clears his voice loudly) And that’s Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How do ya do.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: What’s…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, well, he’s…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s doin’ some thinkin’!
[cut to later, Joey, Rachel, Ross, and Tim are watching the football game, and they all cheer loudly.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What happened? What happened?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You kissed my girlfriend!
(A commercial for sunglasses comes on.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I like those sunglasses.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Like ‘em, like ‘em? Or, I’d like to get store credit for that amount like ‘em?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.parenthetical: Swears in Italian, it’s the same term used by Joey earlier and Joey nods his approval.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right everybody, this turkey is ready!

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Where can I wash up?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here, let me show you. Okay, the towels are hanging next to the sink, and umm, you can use the fancy soap.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fancy soap? I thought we were savin’ that for the Pope!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See he’s nice. Right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but Monica, do you actually want to be in a relationship where you can actually use the phrase, “That’s not how your dad used to do it.”

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Wow! Everything looks great! Where should I sit?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I saved you a seat. (Motions to the one next to her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sick-sick-sick-sick.
(There’s a loud knocking.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’ll get it. (goes over to the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Gotcha! (laughs)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That doesn’t sound like thinking to me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know I don’t think you should be talking at all in there! I think you’ve got to much thinking to do to be talking and making jokes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay, you got it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, can you pass me the yams?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure! Oh, and Joey’s got the mashed potatoes if you want to exchange them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would you stop?! What is the matter with you?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh-ho-ho, we’ve got company.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There’s nothing the matter with me. See, I’m not completely devoid of sentiment, see I have feelings.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, fine. (She gets up and walks into her bedroom)
(an awkward silence follows)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can’t tell, but I’m trying to break the tension by mooning you guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, look! If this is just a big joke to you, then forget about it, all right?! This means something to me! And if it doesn’t mean anything to you, then you should get out of there, otherwise you’re just an idiot in a box!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re right, and I’m sorry! This means a lot to me! I want you to be my friend again! I swear, I won’t say another word tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So are you gonna start taking this thing seriously?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Absolutely!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That sounds like another word to me! Are you gonna take this seriously? (There’s no response from Chandler.) Okay.
(Rachel comes back carrying a shoe box.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t say that I have no sentiment! (Starts to show Ross what’s in the box.) This is a movie stub from our first date! This is an eggshell from the first time you made me breakfast in bed! (Holds up a bone) This is from the museum from the first time we… were together. Okay, maybe I exchange gifts sometimes, but I keep the things that matter!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know what to say, I’m sorry. Though, you’re not supposed to take these. (Points to the bone) It’s like a million years old, we, we actually, we had people looking for that.
(Rachel glares at him.)
[Cut to the balcony with Monica and Tim.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, this always happens. (Her coat gets stuck.)

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Here, let me help. (Does so.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: You-you have a very beautiful… eye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know all my friends think this is weird.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Y’know I-I thought it was gonna be weird, I mean I almost called and canceled, but it really isn’t.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! I mean it’s like me and your dad, that’s a totally separate thing.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Oh, I totally agree.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re just two people who find each other very attractive. Right?
(Tim leans in to kiss her. They stop, and when he tries to kiss her again, Monica pulls away.)

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing. Nothing.

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: No-no really, was-was that not okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no-no that was good, it was, that was uh, that was a goood kiss…

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Oh my God! It didn’t remind you of…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t say it!

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: No, but it did! Didn’t it?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Tim
content.text: Oh man!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!
(They both shiver in horror.)
[cut to later, Tim has left. Monica is still shivering. There’s a knock on the door.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll get it. (It’s Kathy.)
KATHY: (sees it’s Joey) Oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.
KATHY: Hey. Listen, I want you to know how sorry I am…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s okay. Chandler’s the one I’m mad at.
KATHY: Well, I’m still sorry. Is he here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: In the box.
KATHY: (going over to the box) Chandler?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, he-he can’t talk right now.
KATHY: Why not? What’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He’s just trying to show Joey how much he means to him.
KATHY: By being in a box?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, had reasons.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They were threefold.

KATHY: Oh. Well uh, (to Chandler) you not being able to talk may make this easier. Listen umm… (She looks at the gang who are watching, they take the hint and leave them alone.) Listen I don’t wanna be someone who comes between two best friends. I just, I can’t stand seeing what this is doing to you guys, and I don’t wanna be the cause of that. So, I don’t think we can see each other anymore. I’m gonna go to my mom’s in Chicago, I’m gonna stay there for awhile. I think this could’ve be something really amazing, but y’know this is probably for the best. Y’know? I’m gonna miss you. Good-bye, Chandler.
(She gets up and leaves, Chandler waves good-bye with one finger extended through the air hole. Ross glares at Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Open the box!! (Runs over to do so.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He can still catch her! Come on, get out of there! (He opens the box) Get out of there!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we’re gonna be fine! Get out!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you did some real good thinkin’ in there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Man, this is…
(Joey says something unintelligible and they hug.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now go! ‘Cause you can still catch her! And Merry Christmas from you’re secret Santa! (Chandler runs out and closes the door.)
(After he’s gone.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, who got Chandler? ‘Cause I uh, need to trade.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s Balcony, the gang is all there watching Chandler.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, he sees her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, he’s catching up to her!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, she sees him! Oh, they’re hugging!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He’s taking her purse!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, that’s not them. I’m gonna go call the police.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, there they are!
(They watch them making up and sigh)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, get a room.
